dataStructure.name: sid.org.tmforum.tip.customer.bcoll.dunning.DunningCase
dataStructure.description:
The DunningCase represents a type of cases open for a customer. Whenever a customer enters the dunning process, a dunning case is linked to his customer account debt and it contains all details pertaining to the debt, such as dunning case rules, interactions and The status of a dunning case evolves according to internal or external events (payments made by the customer, payment schedule granted).

This entity is optional
dataStructure.label: DunningCase

child.name: iD
child.description:
A unique identifier.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is mandatory

This attribute is AVC enabled
child.label: iD

child.name: startingDate
child.description:
As soon as an event triggering a DunningRule occurs on a CustomerAccount, a DunningCase is created according to the DunningScenario assigned to the CustomerAccount. This date corresponds to the startingDate

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is mandatory

This attribute is AVC enabled
child.label: startingDate

child.name: dunningScenario
child.description:
This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has multiplicity 0..1

This association end has aggregation none

This association end is navigable

This association end is unique

This association end is an end of association DunningCaseApplies

This association end is optional
child.label: dunningScenario

child.name: dunningCaseRule
child.description:
This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has multiplicity *

This association end has aggregation none

This association end is navigable

This association end is unique

This association end is an end of association DunningCaseContains

This association end is optional
child.label: dunningCaseRule

child.name: customerAccount
child.description:
